[Teacher]: But I was in for a rude awakening. When we arrived at the restaurant, the owner greeted us and said that they didn't serve kosher food. I was shocked and disappointed. I thought that Japan, being a country with a strong Buddhist and Shinto tradition, would be more accommodating to dietary restrictions. But, it seems that the food options in Japan are limited when it comes to kosher meals. In fact, many restaurants in Japan do not even carry kosher certification. So, my parents and I

text:

[Student]: A brilliantly funny book with loads of animals to spot perfect for every animal lover
[Teacher]: ! The book 'They're not like us' is full of animals and animals and more animals! You will spot dogs, cats, birds, insects, and even a hedgehog. Each picture is full of personality and each animal has its own story to tell. The fun is just the beginning - there's also an educational element, with fun facts and information about all of the different creatures. Kids will love the funny and sometimes ridiculous situations that the animals find themselves in. 'They're not like

[Student]: Author in the highly acclaimed The Cat Burglars Book Award for Best Witness Word Album 2017 MadeFor Me is a must
[Teacher]: -listen for cat lovers, cat parents, cat caregivers, and anyone who has ever had a special bond with a feline friend. This album is a tribute to all the cats who have touched our lives and hearts.  The author shares his own personal stories about the felines he has cared for, including his beloved cat, Luna. With humor, wit, and warmth, he recounts the adventures of his cat, from the time Luna learned to ride the subway to the time she got lost in the
[Student]: woods to find her familys favourite food item luna pork
[Teacher]: chops. This is an album that will make you laugh, cry, and maybe even inspire you to get a pet of your own. You will learn about the different species of cats, their unique personalities, and the importance of their companionship.  There are also stories about the different ways of caring for cats, from feeding and grooming to health and wellness. This album is a must-listen for anyone who loves cats. (Pamela, Amazon reviewer) Reviewer Pamela had been a

[Teacher]: about a family and their beloved cat who they adopted on December 23rd 2006 and who became a part of their family and helped them to heal from their personal struggles through their play and companionshipThe book is a great choice for kids aged 8-12 who love cats and are interested in learning about their personalities and the importance of their companionship. [Teacher]: , so you have to be true to your art and not just follow trends. I think that's a great point. It's easy to get caught up in what's popular or what's trending, but at the end of the day, it's about creating something real and true to who you are as an artist. It's not about trying to fit into a mold or follow someone else's path. Your music is a reflection of your soul, and it's what sets you apart from others.

STARTER: Do you celebrate any holidays with your family? Are there any special traditions or funny stories from past celebrations?
text:
[Starter]: Do you celebrate any holidays with your family? Are there any special traditions or funny stories from past celebrations?
[Student]: Many of us enjoy the joys and silliest parts in life with this book to remember everyones favourite holiday gift
[Teacher]: , funny party hats, and fun activities to do on special occasions. Happy Holidays from everyone at [Your Business]. There are many different ways to approach this prompt. Here's a possible response:  ---  Happy Holidays from my family to yours!  We always make an effort to celebrate the winter holidays together, and it's a time for us to unwind and recharge. Our family traditions are a mix of old and new. We start by decorating the tree and house with lights and ornaments, and then we make
[Student]: them into our world
[Teacher]: for the season.  One of our favorite activities is making hot chocolate with marshmallows. We always have a few funny stories from past celebrations.  Like the time my sister accidentally knocked over a candle on the tree and set off the fire alarm.  Or the time my dad tried to make cookies with a mix, but ended up with a batch that was too hard and had to be thrown away.  We also enjoy singing Christmas carols and watching holiday movies.  One of our favourite
[Student]: things about this Thanksgiving in my country was when I saw snowshoeing through the streets of Milton Keynes National Park as well as during the weekend because it caused great excitement like no other than the days before Christmas dinner in New York City the whole day after Thanksgiving wasnt back and as the festivities continued again they made the festive atmosphere brighter with Santa onion instead of overpopulated ones all over the city except Sunday afternoon evenings were cancelled overnight because people didn
[Teacher]: ’t like the idea of being in crowded places. Another family tradition we have is to make homemade cookies and decorate them with icing and sprinkles. We also like to play games and have a big dinner together.  One of our favorite family activities is playing board games.  We always make an effort to spend quality time together, and we love seeing the smile on each other's faces when we play games and share stories.  We have a few funny stories from past celebrations.  Like the time
